If $ a \neq b$, $ a^3 - b^3 = 19x^3$, and $ a-b = x$, which of the following conclusions is correct?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ a=3x \qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ a=3x \text{ or } a = -2x \qquad$\\
$ \textbf{(C)}\ a=-3x \text{ or } a = 2x \qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ a=3x \text{ or } a=2x \qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ a=2x$
